name: stexls-vscode-client
description: VSCode client for the stex language server

stexls.pythonInterpreter.description: The python executable used to starts the server. The selected interpreter must have the stexls package installed. This setting can be the complete path to the interpreter executable. (restart required)

stexls.compileWorkspaceOnStartup.description: The server will compile every file in the workspace on startup if enabled. This will take advantage of multiprocessing and @stexls.numJobs to speed it up. The server will be able to make diagnostics based on every file and symbol in the workspace. This process is cancellable by pressing the 'Cancel' button of the progress display that appears while this process is running. (restart required)

stexls.lintWorkspaceOnStartup.description: Lint every file in the workspace on startup. This is useful if you always want to see all diagnostics on all files from the start. This process may take a long time, but is cancellable at any time. (restart required)

stexls.enableTrefier.description: Enables diagnostics based on trefier tagging. Requires installation of the server with the [ml] extras. (restart required)

stexls.enabelLintingOfRelatedFiles.description: Lint every file that directly or indirectly references a file that was changed. Enable 'Compile Workspace on Startup' for this to work properly. Because only compiled and buffered files are searched. (restart required)

stexls.numJobs.description: Number of processes used for compilation of the workspace. (restart required)

stexls.delay.description: Delay when buffering linting jobs. Linting is buffered for <value> seconds after the user stops typing, opens a file or saves. (restart required)

stexls.logfile.description: Path to logfile used by the server. Logs information according to loglevel in this file. (restart required)

stexls.loglevel.description: The maximum log level. Setting it to 'error' will only log errors, but 'info' will log 'warning' and 'errors' as well. (restart required)

stexls.command.description: The command executed by the selected python interpreter. This should start the language server. Go to a terminal and type 'python -m stexls lsp --help' for more information. This should never have to change.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
